# Congrats! 

_Well done, you have completed this course!_

Let's recap what you have accomplished in this course:

1. You learned how to copy a github template
1. You learned about GitHub's Issues tracker
1. You learned about markup languages
1. You used Markdown to comment, commit, and edit files
1. You commited updates to a file in GitHub
1. You created one element of a digital portfolio (a personalized GitHub Profile)
1. You experienced the power of GitHub actions throughout this course

Building your profile is the first step to creating a intentional digital presence. Now make it really special.

- [Create dynamic text images](https://github.com/denvercoder1/readme-typing-svg)
- [Automatically update GitHub activity](https://github.com/jamesgeorge007/github-activity-readme)
- [Generate user statistic plots](https://github.com/vn7n24fzkq/github-profile-summary-cards)

Get inspiration and experience from:

- [Some awesome READMEs](https://github.com/matiassingers/awesome-readme)
- [Take another GitHub Skills course](https://github.com/skills).
- [Read the GitHub Getting Started docs](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started).
